Intervention: Trastuzumab 4 mg/kg intravenous load dose (iv) over 90 minutes, followed by weekly doses of 2 mg/kg iv over 30 minutes plus 1 mg oral dose of anastrozole per day for 24 months in the main and extension phases.

During the main phase, 1 mg of oral anastrozole daily for 24 months. During the extension phase, participants could also receive trastuzumab 4 mg/kg of initial intravenous loading (iv) over 90 minutes, followed by weekly doses of 2 mg/kg iv over 30 minutes.
Eligibility: Metastatic breast cancer is suitable for endocrine treatment;
Overexpression of human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2).
• Uncontrolled heart disease and a history of heart failure.
Results: For two-dimensional malignant lesions with an area of at least 2.0 square centimetres (cm^2), an increase of 1.0 cm^2 was required and for one-dimensional lesions of 1.0 cm or less, an increase of 0.5 cm was required. PFS was defined as the number of days between the date of randomization and the date of documented progression of the disease or the date of death.
Duration: 24 months, end of study (up to 5 years)
Title of the arm/group: Trastuzumab + Anastrozole

Description of the arm/group: Trastuzumab 4 mg/kg intravenous load dose (iv) over 90 minutes, followed by weekly doses of 2 mg/kg iv over 30 minutes plus 1 mg oral dose of anastrozole per day for 24 months in the main and extension phases.
Unit of measure: month 24 months: 4.8 (3.7 to 7)
In the prolongation phase, participants could also receive trastuzumab 4 mg/kg intravenous initial load (iv) over 90 minutes, followed by weekly doses of 2 mg/kg iv over 30 minutes.
Unit of measure: month 24 months: 2.4 (2 to 4.6)
